page.title: 08Social Life,Turvey
page.content: The village has a variety of well supported activities.News of most of these can be found in the quarterly magazine "Turvey News" which also provides a platform for discussion of village matters.Each issue is distributed free of charge to every house in Turvey.It is produced by a commitee of volunteers and relies on adverts and donations to cover costs.The mother and toddler group,pre-school playgroup, Brownies, Guides, Boys Club, Youth Club, W.I. Mothers Union, Evergreeen Club, Lacemakers, Badminton, Aerobics and indoor bowls all meet in the village hall and adjacent rooms.A Recreation Association raise funds and promotes recreation in Turvey.The Stonefield has been acquired and brought into use for football, tennis and a play area.The cricket club use Turvey park.
